name: Mac Linux USB Loader
tagline: Tool allowing you to put a Linux distribution on a USB drive and make it bootable on Intel Macs using EFI.
body:
## Mac Linux USB Loader
This is a tool allowing you to put a Linux distro on a USB drive and make it bootable on Intel Macs using EFI. Right now, it's very basic and rudimentary but is being very actively developed.

<iframe width="560" height="315" src="https://www.youtube-nocookie.com/embed/8tNNbrM02PE?rel=0" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

To build it, perform the following steps from the command line:

```
mkdir whatever
cd whatever
git clone git@github.com:SevenBits/Mac-Linux-USB-Loader.git
xcodebuild
```

You can also go into the Xcode project and build from there, but that makes a debug build that is not useful unless you intend you help develop the application.

[Click here](http://sevenbits.github.com/downloads/Mac-Linux-USB-Loader.zip) for the most semi-stable recent build (I'll try to keep that up to date ;) ). You can also older download pre-build binaries [here](https://github.com/SevenBits/Mac-Linux-USB-Loader/downloads), though using the recent version is recommended in all cases. Building the program yourself is _the best way_ to see the new features.

And when I say this is beta-quality software, I mean it. It may eat your hamster.
